reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price we paid for this hotel, it is more than GREAT! Location is excellent, within a walking distance to the Ramblas, Museu of Picasso, the plaza where all the tours depart etc, staff is very nice and really want to serve you. We loved it!!
reviews.title: Regencia Colon - a very cosy hotel in Barcelona

likes.disliked: — they should have a business center with 1 or 2 computers. They only have wi-fi spot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights since july 27.The room was a corner room (459), had a direct view to the cathedral square.The room was daily clean.it has a safe and an LCD TV.the breakfast had a wide varaity.The staff were extremely helpful,THANKS.they offered us map of the city and metro.The location is superb.1 minute from the cathedral square,5 minutes from the ramblas and the main shopping streets of barcelona.Also it is a very short walk from Jaume1 metro station where you can catch the metro to the beach(2 stops).I would defenetly stay in this hotel when i am back in barcelona.Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great Hotel plus great location

reviews.text: This is a small hotel, a sister to the Hotel Colon. It is a block from the Cathedral in Barrio Gotico. The staff is multi-lingual, very helpful and friendly. The rooms were great. Our friends had a room with a large terrace where we sat at night with wine and tapas. We had a triple room with our teen aged son. The room was large for European standards at a great price. We were a short walk from Las Ramblas, and the Plaza de Cataluña. There are plenty of restaurants in the area. This hotel is a great value for the money and we can't wait to return.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Regencia Colon for 3 night in 01/07. Its in a great location (bang in the middle of the Gothic Quarter) only minuted from the La Ramblas.The staff were also extremely helpful ,given the reputation British tourists have in Spain.One review had mentioned the noise at night but we did not find it a problem (things might be different in summer)
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff
Great value hotel in an even better location
reviews.text: Would definitely stay there again next time we are in Barcelona.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just ask for the one room that has a private terrace, thats what I did, it didnt cost me any more than a standard room and was absolutely perfect! the staff were more than friendlt, it was very very comfortable with great air con, and i was recommended by the manager a fantastic local restaurant, im sure he'd oblige and assist.
reviews.title: Great place - ask for the room with a terrace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location speaks for itself, right next to the cathedral, but behind the hotel colon so it's pretty quiet too! (mind you it backs on to a very very busy main road (but doesnt everywhere) so when the window or in our case terrace door is open it's pretty busy sounding.
reviews.title: Bad customer service experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, I thought the property was a good value for the money in central Barcelona. The rooms were relatively clean and surprisingly quiet givent the location.
reviews.title: Great sightseeing place to stay

likes.disliked: — No kettle for my afternoon tea !!

reviews.title: Warm, personal service
reviews.text: The location is excellent for tourists and within walking distance of the cathedral, museums, Las Ramblas, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was nice of the hotel to provide a one-page summary of tips to avoid crime in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: This hotel is truly within walking distance to Plaza Catalunya and Jaume metro stations, which made it extremely easy to get anywhere else in the city. It is almost directly behind Snata Creu, which is nice. Our room faced the street and it wasn't noisy at night. We were there Oct 29-Nov 1, 2007. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. Occasionally, we heard plumbers working on the pipes, but it was during the day, and not distracting. The only negative, if you can call it that, was lack of internet access. You had to go across the alley to their sister hotel Hotel Colon, to use the WiFi. Even then, it was unreliable. I HIGHLY recommend La Locanda restaurant, which is very close to the Regencia Y Colon. Great food, decent prices. I'm still craving their gnocchi pesto!
reviews.title: PERFECT Location!

reviews.text: This hotel is a great value. We paid 70 euro for a room with twin beds - what a deal! The location is amazing - it's an easy walk to all the sights, to the Ramblas, and to the main square. I would not recommend the breakfast - it costs 10 euro and is not very good - we opted for McDonald's, which is right down the street. The front desk is very very helpful with tours, restaurants, etc. The hotel feels very safe and secure. I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel for the location and the staff and the value! The only con is that the walls are paper thin, so if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: There wasn't much wrong with this hotel for me and my family (wife and two and a half year old son) except that it was a little noisy of a night.
reviews.title: I like it, but it is a little noisy

reviews.text: The room (Triple room) was a good size and the airconditioning was good and effective. The bathroom was a little cozy but functional and not a problem for us.
reviews.title: Good location,very clean,very reasonable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't partake of breakfast as we prefered to eat out. (there's sso many eateries nearby!)
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

likes.disliked: — Instead of a king bed, our room had 2 doubles pushed together

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had stayed at the Colon many years ago when in Barcelona on business. Therefore the Regencia Colon attrracted my attention as I liked the Colon. Both hotels are very well located in the heart of the city with public transporation near by and the famous Rambla just a few minutes away on foot.
reviews.title: Lots of street noise

reviews.text: The hotel is lovely with a good sized room, a nice bathroom, a helpful front office crew, and a very good breakfast for 10 Euros. Barcelona is an expensive city so 135 Euros for a double seemed reasonable.
reviews.title: Okay but Hotel Mont Blanc better
We said that we would be back and we have been
reviews.text: I would suggest that one find a quieter place if sleeping is a priority. Revelers, garbage trucks and construction never ceased. Other than that, the hotel is fine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decent rate of 115 euro for single room with no breakfast. Location was good, rooms okay. Unfortunately there is something about being in or near a square and having windows facing the activity. The occasional loud people during the night were not as irritating as the
reviews.title: Few comments on this hotel..only complaint was

reviews.text: garbage trucks dumping cans of glass bottles late at night or EARLY in the morning. Then the construction work begins early most every morning. The windows are old and new thermopane windows would most likely diminish the level of disturbance from the outside. We stayed the 2nd half of our stay up the street at the Hotel Mont Blanc which charged 103 euro per single room and that included one of the best breakfasts I've ever had in Europe. The hotel had a computer with internet available in the lobby if you didn't have your own computer (Regencia had internet if you had your own computer with you).
reviews.title: Fantastic Location
